description: Creates the replication instance using the specified parameters. DMS requires that your account have certain roles with appropriate permissions before you can create a replication instance. For information on the required roles, see Creating the IAM Roles to Use With the CLI and DMS API. For information on the required permissions, see IAM Permissions Needed to Use DMS.

parameters.name: ReplicationInstanceIdentifier
parameters.description: The replication instance identifier. This parameter is stored as a lowercase string. Constraints: Must contain 1-63 alphanumeric characters or hyphens. First character must be a letter. Can't end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens. Example: myrepinstance.

parameters.name: ReplicationInstanceClass
parameters.description: The compute and memory capacity of the replication instance as defined for the specified replication instance class. For example to specify the instance class dms.c4.large, set this parameter to "dms.c4.large". For more information on the settings and capacities for the available replication instance classes, see Choosing the right DMS replication instance; and, Selecting the best size for a replication instance.

parameters.name: VpcSecurityGroupIds
parameters.description: Specifies the VPC security group to be used with the replication instance. The VPC security group must work with the VPC containing the replication instance. (string) ---

parameters.name: PreferredMaintenanceWindow
parameters.description: The weekly time range during which system maintenance can occur, in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC). Format: ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi Default: A 30-minute window selected at random from an 8-hour block of time per Amazon Web Services Region, occurring on a random day of the week. Valid Days: Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri, Sat, Sun Constraints: Minimum 30-minute window.

parameters.name: EngineVersion
parameters.description: The engine version number of the replication instance. If an engine version number is not specified when a replication instance is created, the default is the latest engine version available.

parameters.name: AutoMinorVersionUpgrade
parameters.description: A value that indicates whether minor engine upgrades are applied automatically to the replication instance during the maintenance window. This parameter defaults to true. Default: true.

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: One or more tags to be assigned to the replication instance. (dict) --- A user-defined key-value pair that describes metadata added to an DMS resource and that is used by operations such as the following: AddTagsToResource ListTagsForResource RemoveTagsFromResource Key (string) --- A key is the required name of the tag. The string value can be 1-128 Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with 'aws:' or 'dms:'. The string can only contain only the set of Unicode letters, digits, white-space, --_', --.', --/', --=', --+', ---' (Java regular expressions: '^([\p{L}\p{Z}\p{N}_.:/=+\-]*)$'). Value (string) --- A value is the optional value of the tag. The string value can be 1-256 Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with 'aws:' or 'dms:'. ResourceArn (string) --- The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) string that uniquely identifies the resource for which the tag is created.

parameters.name: KmsKeyId
parameters.description: An KMS key identifier that is used to encrypt the data on the replication instance. If you don't specify a value for the KmsKeyId parameter, then DMS uses your default encryption key. KMS creates the default encryption key for your Amazon Web Services account. Your Amazon Web Services account has a different default encryption key for each Amazon Web Services Region.

parameters.name: KerberosAuthenticationSettings
parameters.description: Specifies the settings required for kerberos authentication when creating the replication instance. KeyCacheSecretId (string) --- Specifies the ID of the secret that stores the key cache file required for kerberos authentication. KeyCacheSecretIamArn (string) --- Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that grants Amazon Web Services DMS access to the secret containing key cache file for the kerberos authentication. Krb5FileContents (string) --- Specifies the contents of krb5 configuration file required for kerberos authentication.

nested_params.name: KeyCacheSecretId
nested_params.description: Specifies the ID of the secret that stores the key cache file required for kerberos authentication.

nested_params.name: KeyCacheSecretIamArn
nested_params.description: Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that grants Amazon Web Services DMS access to the secret containing key cache file for the kerberos authentication.

nested_params.name: Krb5FileContents
nested_params.description: Specifies the contents of krb5 configuration file required for kerberos authentication.

nested_items.name: ReplicationInstance
nested_items.description: The replication instance that was created.

nested_items.name: ReplicationInstanceIdentifier
nested_items.description: The replication instance identifier is a required parameter. This parameter is stored as a lowercase string.
Must contain 1-63 alphanumeric characters or hyphens.
First character must be a letter.
Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.

nested_items.name: ReplicationInstanceClass
nested_items.description: The compute and memory capacity of the replication instance as defined for the specified replication instance class. It is a required parameter, although a default value is pre-selected in the DMS console.

nested_items.name: ReplicationInstanceStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the replication instance. The possible return values include:
"available"
"creating"
"deleted"
"deleting"
"failed"
"modifying"
"upgrading"
"rebooting"
"resetting-master-credentials"
"storage-full"
"incompatible-credentials"
"incompatible-network"
"maintenance"

nested_items.name: AllocatedStorage
nested_items.description: The amount of storage (in gigabytes) that is allocated for the replication instance.

nested_items.name: InstanceCreateTime
nested_items.description: The time the replication instance was created.

nested_items.name: VpcSecurityGroups
nested_items.description: The VPC security group for the instance.

nested_items.name: VpcSecurityGroupId
nested_items.description: The VPC security group ID.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the VPC security group.

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZone
nested_items.description: The Availability Zone for the instance.

nested_items.name: ReplicationSubnetGroup
nested_items.description: The subnet group for the replication instance.

nested_items.name: ReplicationSubnetGroupIdentifier
nested_items.description: The identifier of the replication instance subnet group.

nested_items.name: ReplicationSubnetGroupDescription
nested_items.description: A description for the replication subnet group.

nested_items.name: VpcId
nested_items.description: The ID of the VPC.

nested_items.name: SubnetGroupStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the subnet group.

nested_items.name: Subnets
nested_items.description: The subnets that are in the subnet group.

nested_items.name: SubnetIdentifier
nested_items.description: The subnet identifier.

nested_items.name: SubnetAvailabilityZone
nested_items.description: The Availability Zone of the subnet.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the Availability Zone.

nested_items.name: SubnetStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the subnet.

nested_items.name: SupportedNetworkTypes
nested_items.description: The IP addressing protocol supported by the subnet group. This is used by a replication instance with values such as IPv4 only or Dual-stack that supports both IPv4 and IPv6 addressing. IPv6 only is not yet supported.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: PreferredMaintenanceWindow
nested_items.description: The maintenance window times for the replication instance. Any pending upgrades to the replication instance are performed during this time.

nested_items.name: PendingModifiedValues
nested_items.description: The pending modification values.

nested_items.name: ReplicationInstanceClass
nested_items.description: The compute and memory capacity of the replication instance as defined for the specified replication instance class.

nested_items.name: AllocatedStorage
nested_items.description: The amount of storage (in gigabytes) that is allocated for the replication instance.

nested_items.name: MultiAZ
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the replication instance is a Multi-AZ deployment. You can't set the AvailabilityZone parameter if the Multi-AZ parameter is set to true.

nested_items.name: EngineVersion
nested_items.description: The engine version number of the replication instance.

nested_items.name: NetworkType
nested_items.description: The type of IP address protocol used by a replication instance, such as IPv4 only or Dual-stack that supports both IPv4 and IPv6 addressing. IPv6 only is not yet supported.

nested_items.name: MultiAZ
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the replication instance is a Multi-AZ deployment. You can't set the AvailabilityZone parameter if the Multi-AZ parameter is set to true.

nested_items.name: EngineVersion
nested_items.description: The engine version number of the replication instance.

nested_items.name: AutoMinorVersionUpgrade
nested_items.description: Boolean value indicating if minor version upgrades will be automatically applied to the instance.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: An KMS key identifier that is used to encrypt the data on the replication instance.

nested_items.name: ReplicationInstanceArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the replication instance.

nested_items.name: ReplicationInstancePublicIpAddress
nested_items.description: The public IP address of the replication instance.

nested_items.name: ReplicationInstancePrivateIpAddress
nested_items.description: The private IP address of the replication instance.

nested_items.name: ReplicationInstancePublicIpAddresses
nested_items.description: One or more public IP addresses for the replication instance.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ReplicationInstancePrivateIpAddresses
nested_items.description: One or more private IP addresses for the replication instance.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ReplicationInstanceIpv6Addresses
nested_items.description: One or more IPv6 addresses for the replication instance.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: PubliclyAccessible
nested_items.description: Specifies the accessibility options for the replication instance. A value of true represents an instance with a public IP address. A value of false represents an instance with a private IP address. The default value is true.

nested_items.name: SecondaryAvailabilityZone
nested_items.description: The Availability Zone of the standby replication instance in a Multi-AZ deployment.

nested_items.name: FreeUntil
nested_items.description: The expiration date of the free replication instance that is part of the Free DMS program.

nested_items.name: DnsNameServers
nested_items.description: The DNS name servers supported for the replication instance to access your on-premise source or target database.

nested_items.name: NetworkType
nested_items.description: The type of IP address protocol used by a replication instance, such as IPv4 only or Dual-stack that supports both IPv4 and IPv6 addressing. IPv6 only is not yet supported.

nested_items.name: KerberosAuthenticationSettings
nested_items.description: Specifies the settings required for kerberos authentication when replicating an instance.

nested_items.name: KeyCacheSecretId
nested_items.description: Specifies the ID of the secret that stores the key cache file required for kerberos authentication.

nested_items.name: KeyCacheSecretIamArn
nested_items.description: Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that grants Amazon Web Services DMS access to the secret containing key cache file for the kerberos authentication.

nested_items.name: Krb5FileContents
nested_items.description: Specifies the contents of krb5 configuration file required for kerberos authentication.
